WRITING.TEXT: Not a high school teacher, but when I was in high school I was doing singing valentines and I had to sing "For the Longest Time" to one of my past teachers. One of the lyrics I had to sing was "You're that voice I'm hearing in the hall, and the greatest miracle of all, is how I need you, and how you needed me too, that hasn't happened for the longest time." It was pretty awkward. I didn't know whether to make eye contact or not.
Also, did you know that soaking your hands in lizard pee is an effective cure for dermatemeculitis.
No the idea is gross to me. You're essentially turning your shower into a urinal or toilet and I definitely do not want to get clean in the same place I piss.
upvoted for "anger cocoons"
This is so well edited lol. I feel like this season could use a little Lillian Morris.

It was also nice seeing him comfort Varner as well. He confronted Varner for doing something bad and wasn't afraid to let him know what he said was out of line, but at the end of the day he was compassionate and forgiving enough to still make sure he was okay.
For me it's Sierra and Andrea, but still going into this season I was a fan of 8 of the girls and only about 2 of the guys.
I was expecting her to have a confessional about how everyone else is all emotional but she just wants to play the game lol.

What Varner did was stupid and ignorantly harmful, but the way people are reacting to it is just straight up malicious and it's like no one ever learned in elementary school that two wrongs don't make a right.

I think the reason why I feel more inclined to sympathize with Varner is because no one else did in the episode. What he did is awful but it's extremely uncomfortable to watch 7 people gang up on someone and put them on blast, even if that one person is in the wrong. I just put myself in that situation and know I would feel a lot shittier being Varner than Zeke.

Also Varner was apparently suicidal about this. Zeke handled it very well. People being concerned about Varner isn't them saying he's in the right, it's them knowing he's going to suffer harder from this and trying to alleviate this.
Yeah if Brad and Zeke go head to head I have no doubt Brad would come out on top. Brad has practically all of the Mana members in his palm while Zeke only really has the Tavua 4.

And if Nuku had won immunity (Shipwreck would have been a much better answer to the puzzle imo) then we never would've had to deal with this situation, Zeke wouldn't be outed, Varner's reputation wouldn't be destroyed, and Brad Culpepper could have gone home :(.
I can understand both sides. The realistic part of my brain says of course it isn't staged but the conspiracy loving part says Survivor got a loooot of attention after this.

Yeah the boot order has been pretty bad as far as Mana-Nuku lines and actual game changers going home, but I'm really glad the merge is 8 females to 5 males because the girls cast on this season are so much more interesting to me.
That was after RI, where every player except her and Boston Rob was as useless as a pudding cup. Of course she would seem like a threat in her next season.
That was after RI, where every player except her and Boston Rob was as useless as a pudding cup. Of course she would seem like a threat in her next season.
Sorry I was in a rush to respond I meant Andrea.
It still could've been named after everything that happened on Mana though.
Also it's important not to overglorify him. He handled the situation very tastefully but that doesn't mean that Zeke is suddenly the best person ever who can do no wrong.
Why was this episode named what happens at exile stays at exile? It had like nothing to do with 90% of the episode
That excuse flies maybe for Zeke but I don't see Sarah ever being a big target
Personal stuff aside, he played pretty poorly and almost convinced his tribe to flip on Ozzy unintentionally. Had Varner not been a dick, he may have been screwed.
She wanted to keep Ozzy in past the merge. I see no reason why that's good for her game
They aren't the same thing though because, from what I understand of Varner's intentions, he would have done that with any personal detail. It wasn't about the transexuality, it was about the secret.
No, it's not. And just saying it is doesn't make it so.
Varner wasn't saying that Zeke being transgender was deceptive, he was saying that hiding that he was transgender was deceptive. He said an awful thing but don't twist it to be more awful.
Also can we talk about how the reason that Mana started crying was because they didn't win the pizza?
Yeah this really escalates Varner to one of the most tragic Survivor figures of all time.
Yeah you'd better lest you become the next Jenn Brown.
I think it's just as justifiable as any of the other awful things people have done in this game, but it's a more personal and sensitive issue so people are more upset about it.
I like that Cirie and Aubry will seemingly be safe, but I don't like that Brad is just flying by and that he's getting a Cambodia-Jeremy-level-edit
But Varner wasn't saying that Zeke was deceptive because he was transgender he was saying Zeke was deceptive because he didn't tell people he was transgender.
How is being unable to forgive someone and holding malice towards them noble?
Varner wanted to kill himself. How is that not as big of an effect.

I completely agree. What Jeff did was wrong because he didn't know Zeke's background and whether he was out or not, but Zeke has publicly spoken about being transgender and agreed to go on a TV show where your most personal side gets shown to the entire country.
So...you only like Sarah because her opinions changed to match more closely to yours?
Assuming you're referring to tonight's tribal council, in what world was this a good survivor moment? This was probably the most uncomfortable thing to watch in the history of survivor.
Do you even know what transphobic means? It does no one any favors to throw around that word like nothing.
Zeke has openly talked about it before.

Yeah fuck Rob. Everyone was a victim in this situation. What Jeff did was awful but the humiliation he's suffered and will have to suffer from it for the rest of his life make him a victim in my eyes.
At the same time though, if sexuality and gender issues weren't a big deal or weren't worth other people caring about, it wouldn't be a big deal to out someone else.
Yeah that bothered me. It's not like Varner broke the rules of the game, so why should Jeff go against the rules and stop a vote?
Yeah seriously. Weaponizing private information for your own benefit is kinda what survivor is about.
This. Zeke even admitted in the TC that he told people in his regular life.

Because get this: people can do something wrong, and not deserve to be torn to shreds. There is this thing called forgiveness, and when someone does something wrong, but is apologetic for their actions, it's okay to forgive them.

It *really* bothered me that Jeff just cancelled the vote like that. What if Jeff had had a hidden immunity idol? It just really ruins the integrity of the game imo to completely forego the rules just because someone made a mean comment.
It just sucks that in order to protect Zeke's image or life being destroyed from this it has to be flipped 180 and destroy or tarnish Varner's image.
Yeah it's almost just as bad to say that Zeke is some amazing person just for being trans. I don't think that's what Zeke would want people thinking.
It was posted to this sub in MvGX, I think there was a blog post or newspaper article or something about Zeke from a while back that was about him being trans.
And also, Zeke was already out. That's a detail everyone seems to be forgetting. He's been in articles before survivor that discussed him being transgender.

I feel like this was blown way out of proportion. Zeke was OUT. Varner did not out him on national TV. And when you come on a show like Survivor you better be ready for any skeletons in your closet to be revealed.

No I agree, I also had the thought that she should've worked with Tai during the episode. I think with JT though it's a little more justified because he made multiple bad moves instead of one move that wasn't awful but could have been better. I do understand where JT came from though.
Also it's important to remember that it's much easier to say this sort of thing watching on TV. When you're actually out there, I'm sure it's much harder to realize you should make a move like that.
KR no doubt
I've heard a theory that they're doing a leaders style season again where the two or three returnees are the ones who win this.

To me, new school was all about highly strategic gameplay and new twists as far as the seasons themes. If you look at the winners of these seasons (BRob, Kim, Tony, Natalie A) they all played really strategic, innovative games.
I feel like the post-new school designation is necessary because now Survivor has taken a step back from that twisty strategic focus and has regained the social factor from early in the series. Post-new school to me still has a lot of twists, but is more focused on emotional strategy rather than traditional strategy, and more focused on the relationships between people.
I think it could swing this way but my fear would be that Troyzan plays an idol for Brad and get out Aubry or Cirie.

Old School: 1-10 (8 excluded).
Middle School: 8, 11-18.
New School: 19-31.
Post-New School: 32-34

But because it is still in the premerge it means virtually nothing for that player's game. Sure they might look better on TV but being able to adapt at that point in the game isn't going to matter to winning. See: Tasha in Cambodia.

I think it's a fair twist but I wish they'd use more judgement when applying it. It's never going to be interesting to swap the tribes when one of the original tribes is down 9-6 and when one of the first swapped tribes is down 4-5-6. That's just asking for a pagonging that also happens to be unfair to the players.
If Cirie or Aubry go this episode, it is officially the worst boot order of all time.
I hope so. This is best-case scenario shit right here.
If Liz Markham is any evidence, IQ says nothing about your social skills

Yeah but there's such a thing as being too diverse. I didn't know any popular kids at my school that were gay or had gay or interracial parents. It's good to have a few characters like that because then it does represent diversity but when almost every character is in some way diverse there's a problem.

I don't know why this is getting downvoted. Survivor is all about social interaction and politics. If you can't make friends in two days enough to be picked for a tribe, then you shouldn't be on the show.
I would think that Tai and Aubry are the only example where it goes both ways, but we'll see how that works out this season.

Homosexuality is only sinful as long as you act on it. So, if you go around having gay sex your whole life then yes, your whole life will be sinful, but if you resist, it won't be.
I know it's hard, I'm gay too, but that's how life is.

I completely agree. Banjo-Kazooie is fun but Banjo-Tooie is actually challenging and requires thinking to complete. On top of that the worlds are bigger and better designed, there is a boss in every level, and it feels a lot darker. Banjo-Tooie is a great game.

Yes I know I already said I was wrong about Jerri and Colby, but with Amanda and James, for example, that would count because even though Amanda has played without James, James has spent every day in the game with Amanda.

No, they asked for players who have spent every day of their game with another castaway. Just because Castaway A spent every day of their time on Survivor with Castaway B, doesn't mean that Castaway B spent every day of their game on Survivor with Castaway A.
I wrote fanfiction.
Well I don't think op meant both players had to be in with each other, but maybe that was just a misunderstanding of your comment on my behalf.
Yeah but it's near impossible for two people to *only* be in the game at the same time with multiple games.
It's pretty much all memes and spoilers now
Varner being voted out just before the merge again would be so sad but so delightfully dark

And Aubry and Tai are two people! And Tai was the second runner up! And they played in season 32. And Tai has two idols. And both Aubry and him have played twice. I'll stop now.
Half Life 2 confirmed?

how would that benefit you though? If they were suspicious or resentful of that person because they went to the luxury exile, they would be towards you too. If they were fine with it, it wouldn't hurt that person. And I feel like most people would see through that as a shallow attempt to put the target on someone.

It makes me sad because Survivor is probably one of the only things that brings him joy in life so he clings to it and gets over obsessive with it. It's creepy as fuck yeah but I feel bad for him.
Then again I'm just some redditor playing armchair psychologist on him, maybe he's actually a serial killer who knows.
I did this with a final once. This picture sums up my reaction pretty well.
I think if someone else got sent they also would not want to tell anyone, or at least would understand why you didn't tell.
I don't like thin or thick, I like hand-tossed. Not like a cracker but also not like you're eating a loaf of bread.

Don't use Sandra's quotes against me.
Two can play at that game. You're a stupid ass.

I did think about my comment, before posting it the first, and second time for your lazy ass who couldn't bother to read the thread. What you just said made literally no sense and it's making it glaringly obvious how desperately you're grasping for a comeback right now, so I suggest just not responding because it's only going to make you look more dumb.
Why would you want to eat cheese and sauce on what's essentially a cracker?
That was meant ironically though. Hannah and Zeke joked before that tribal that it would sound stupid and jeff just took it and ran with it.

Yeah, I think it's easy to forget about them when there are advantages and twists happening left and right, so proportionally I guess you're right, but if you look hard enough those moments are still there.
I was really expecting them to have a bigger reaction to Sandra being gone, but I guess it was to be expected. I'm glad Jeff stuffed in one last praise of her 3
Michelle in MvGX.

Yeah seriously, I couldn't eat a pizza that size when I'm on a normal diet, but when I haven't eaten for two weeks and my stomach is smaller? Not to mention they get more than a whole pizza for eacch person.
It always looks like thin crust and thin crust pizza is trash.

Eh I don't know about that, JT disliked Michaela before sugargate and everyone was mad at JT already. As far as Debbie, beggars can't be choosers.
Plus we saw Ozzy catching fish as well. We haven't seen that on Survivor in a hot minute.
I think I had an aneurysm watching this stupidity

"Don't worry, I receive an advantage that show me the future and there is outcast twist this season"

I'd say the double tribal from this season. It had both a shocking blindside (to the viewers as well) and was entertaining before people voted. I feel like most of the other classics were only entertaining from when people voted on.
They really didn't show much of her personality but it came out in ponderosa and it was awesome.

With Michelle Schubert I think you need to watch her ponderosa videos to really get it. She got an awful edit that only showed her being strategic or judgemental but in ponderosa she was so funny and charming.
you'd be surprised

Every beauty tribe member from Cagayan for me. LJ and Jeremiah were both dull to me, everyone always says that Alexis and Morgan were hilarious but I remember nothing from Alexis and the only thing I remember about Morgan was her being dumb--which is entertaining, but doesn't need to be shown a second season--and Jefra was interesting but not enough to be brought back.
Sugargate? Debbe and Tai naming the chickens? Debbie freaking out at Brad? All of those were camp life moments as well.

No actually I feel like so far there's been a lot of entertaining character moments that give it substance. Now that Sandra's gone I feel like those will be cut in half, but it hasn't been all sizzle so far.
I don't know whether this was sarcastic or not

No like I already said to someone else, I was making the statement based off of casting in general not specific people. Why don't you take the time to read other comments before wasting my time with pointless bullshit like this

They weren't cast for looks necessarily. Michelle is a missionary (lots of world experience), Figgy has her boxing stuff, and Mari is internet famous. And if you consider Michaela attractive as one of the attractive ones, she also graduated from a really good college and is starting her own business or something I think.
He's the only person in this list that truly quit though, so he's kinda in a different league than the rest of them.

No, if half the millenial tribe isn't attractive then that disproves your point. Will, the youngest castaway in the history of the show, was not the typical hot male. Life experience matters more than looks to modern survivor.

Zeke, Hannah, Will, Adam, and Michaela. Not that they are unattractive, but they aren't people you would look at and go "Wow that's an incredibly attractive person." Attractiveness isn't their most obvious feature.
I wouldn't mind a medivac for a few of the remaining people haha.
It looked to me that that titan was just born there. It looked like a lil baby.
fuck I can't wait
12/18 members of Worlds Apart beg to differ. Also half of the millenials tribe.

hopefully we see a day in which the only returning players who didn't have their torches snuffed and weren't eliminated from the game were either Aubry and/or Tai. I think that speaks a lot more to the quality of gameplay than including people who got medivaced does.
I feel like Jenna will be back for All-Winners. I hope so, it would definitely be interesting to see her play now that she's more grown up.
I'm not claiming to have knowledge of their lives, I'm claiming to have knowledge of what the casting people are looking for after reading a lot of advice on here.
I mean it's possible neither could. But we'll just have to wait and see.
I don't know their lives but I'm sure they had experience travelling or doing volunteer work or something.
Oh right...I think I had him blocked out of my memory haha.

WRITING.TITLE: Fun fact: With Sandra gone, only four returning players have yet to have their torch snuffed on Survivor
WRITING.TEXT: And they are Jenna Morasca, Michael Skupin, Aubry Bracco, and Tai Trang.
